intro: Cyrtandra clarkei var. grandis, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Cyrtandra clarkei var. grandis plays an important ecological role in Hawaiian forests and is considered a keystone species in certain habitats.
